txt.en: 'The dredging machines stand like forgotten hulks in the Gladden Fields, idle now, but not always. Once there was a time when they sifted soil and mud, and drew weapons and armour-pieces from long ago to light. Someone or something has taken these unearthed treasures into Kidzul-kâlah, whether for grave robbery or some other purpose I cannot say. But if that purpose be foul, as I think it must, they should be found and destroyed.'
Weapons taken from the Gladden Fields into Kidzul-kâlah should be destroyed before they can be used for some foul purpose.
Hithril of the Elves of Lórien is concerned about the shadowy waters that surround the sunken ruins of Kidzul-kâlah.
